meanings.definition: To openly disregard or disobey a rule or convention.
meanings.sent1: She was flouting the school dress code by wearing flip-flops.
meanings.sent2: The protesters were flouting the government's orders by gathering in large numbers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student enjoyed flouting the no chewing gum rule in class.
meanings.sent4: His rebellious nature led him to constantly flouting the traffic laws.
meanings.sent5: The pirate captain was notorious for flouting the laws of the sea.

meanings.sent1: The comedian was flouting the politician's speech in a humorous manner.
meanings.sent2: The bullies were flouting the new student's accent during lunch.
meanings.sent3: The children were flouting each other's dance moves at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her sarcastic comments were flouting the seriousness of the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The talk show host enjoyed flouting the absurdity of tabloid headlines.
